summary: This document is an email chain from March 6, 2019, between an Assistant United States Attorney (AUSA) in the Southern District of New York and a contractor, regarding coordinating logistics for the FBI to provide a large amount of Epstein case data for uploading to a shared system. The primary purpose is to arrange a meeting to facilitate the data transfer.

persons.name: Bustillo
persons.context: A contractor (likely with USAO or related) involved in coordinating the receipt and upload of FBI data on the Epstein case. They are arranging a meeting in room 870.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: An AUSA from the Southern District of New York who is requesting coordination between the FBI case agent and a contractor to obtain and upload Epstein case data to a shared system.

connections.description: The AUSA is emailing Bustillo to coordinate logistics for the FBI to provide Epstein case data for uploading to a shared system.

events.title: Coordination for Epstein Data Transfer
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney emails a contractor to coordinate logistics for the FBI to provide a large amount of data on the Epstein case for uploading to a shared system, leading to a meeting arrangement.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The FBI possessed a 'large amount of data' on the Epstein case as of March 2019.
An Assistant U.S. Attorney in the SDNY was actively coordinating the transfer of this FBI data to a shared system.
The communication shows logistical planning between the USAO and a contractor to handle the data upload.
The email chain is focused on arranging a meeting (around 3:30/4 PM on March 6, 2019) to facilitate this data transfer.
